info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 5:40PM EDT until April 8 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...
Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EDT Monday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 14.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON
